job_description:
Under the direction of the Database Marketing Manager, the Marketing Analytics Supervisor will be responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies, analyzing marketing data, A/B testing, and providing actionable insights to drive business decisions. By exploring market trends, competitors, potential and existing customers, the Marketing Analytics Supervisor will help to foster a data driven environment through the creation of models and analysis that drive revenue, profit, and engagement. Will lead a team of Marketing Analysts and assist in the continuous development of team members through training and coaching, while serving as a link between direct reports and upper management.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

1. Data-Driven Decision Making: Lead and manage a team of analysts to make well-informed decisions based on data-driven insights. This individual will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, identifying trends, and presenting findings to stakeholders. They are also responsible for conducting A/B tests and extracting actionable insights to optimize marketing strategies.

2. Improve Efficiency: Takes charge of monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and provides regular reports to evaluate the success of marketing campaigns. Streamlining workflow and coordinating team efforts. The supervisor will assign tasks, set priorities, and ensure that each team member is working efficiently.

3. Forecasting and Trend Analysis: Develop forecasting models and conduct trend analyses to anticipate market changes, customer preferences, and emerging opportunities. Utilize statistical analysis and data visualization techniques to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in both reports and presentations.

4. Enhanced Customer Segmentation: Through advanced data analytics, the Supervisor will aid in segmenting the customer base into meaningful groups based on habits, behavior, preferences, and demographics. This segmentation will enable the Strategic Marketing team to deliver personalized and targeted messages, resulting in higher engagement and customer satisfaction.

5. Quality control and performance: Consistent quality control including, but not limited to, reviewing analysts’ work, approving creative imagery, validating data, providing constructive feedback, and ensuring all team members are adhering to established standards and best practices. Regular performance monitoring and providing feedback will be required.

6. Collaboration, Planning, and Executing: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between marketing department initiatives and overall enterprise goals. This will require working with both internal and external stakeholders as well as vendors.

7. Training and Development: Assist in the training and development of analytics team by identifying skill gaps within the team and developing targeted training programs to assist in building up the team. Including evaluating and implementing progressive marketing analytics tools and technologies.

8. Data Privacy and Compliance: Ensure data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations. Will implement best practices to safeguard customer data and maintain the company’s reputation as a trusted custodian of sensitive information.

9. Performs other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the department and assumes other responsibilities, duties, tasks and assignments that contribute to the mitigation or response to any public health emergency.

Supervisory Responsibilities

Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring and training employees; planning, assigning reviewing and directing work; evaluating and appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Makes hiring decisions and designs individual development plans with succession planning in mind for all key roles.

Education/Experience/Qualifications
• Bachelor's or Master’s degree in business-related or quantitative field (e.g, Economics, Statistics, Math or equivalent) advanced degree required. Master's preferred.
• Minimum of two (2) years of relevant or related analytics experience is required. Casino marketing or casino analytics experience preferred.
• Minimum of one (1) year of supervisory experience is strongly preferred.
• Related, relevant, and/or direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational requirements indicated above.
• Proficient in at least 1 of the following programming languages: Statistical Analysis System (SAS), Structured Query Language (SQL), Python, or R-programming language. Proficiency in SAS is a plus.
• Well versed in data visualization, must have experience with Tableau, Power BI or relative data visualization tools.
• Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
• Must be able to work in a fast paced, high-performance environment with tight deadlines.
• Requires ability to think critically and independently, while at the same time the ability to know when to ask for help; requires excellent common sense.
• Results-oriented mindset with a focus on leveraging data to drive business growth.
• Ability to manage multiple projects based upon defined timelines and variable outcomes required.
• Familiarity with casino operations and an understanding of player behavior and segmentation is strongly preferred.

Certificates/Licenses/Registrations
• At the discretion of the San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission, you may be required to obtain and maintain a gaming license.

Yaamava’ Resort & Casino at San Manuel will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with applicable law.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

Well versed in data visualization, must have experience with Tableau, Power BI or relative data visualization tools
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
Must be able to work in a fast paced, high-performance environment with tight deadlines

Results-oriented mindset with a focus on leveraging data to drive business growth
